document.masterDocTitle: On the status of Microrhopala arizonica Schaeffer (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae Cassidinae: Chalepini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On the status of Microrhopala arizonica Schaeffer (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae Cassidinae: Chalepini)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality: [ México – implied from title of the work], Canelas
.

Microrhopala arizonica Schaeffer
: Weise 1911a:73 [as synonym of
Microrhopala suturalis (Baly)
]

Penthispa suturalis (Baly)
: Weise 1911b:37 [newly combined, incorrect subsequent spelling of generic name]. Type material of
suturalis Baly, 1885
: Lectotype ( Fig 1 ) here designated, sex undetermined, labeled “[light-blue circle border] SYN- | TYPE || Duenas, | Guatemala , | G. C. Champion || Godman-Salvin | Coll., Biol. | Centr.-Amer. || Chalepus | suturalis | Baly | Guatemala || [red label] LECTOTYPE |
Chalepus
|
suturalis Baly
| desig. E.G.Riley”. Conserved in NHML , card mounted, in good condition, distal antennomeres of right antenna glued to card. Baly (1885) did not indicate a type, and since he did not state the number of specimens before him and nothing provided in the work implies that he had more than one specimen, the number of originally included specimens cannot be definitively determined. To fix the application of this name, a lectotype is designated. Repositor(ies) of possible paralectotypes unknown. Baly (1886) added the locality Cordova, México for this species, but this supplement was issued the year following the original description so the specimen(s) from this locality are not part of the type series.

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 1.
Chalepus suturalis Baly
, lectotype and labels. Fig. 2.
Microrhopala arizonica Schaeffer
, lectotype and labels. Figs 3-8,
Pentispa suturalis (Baly)
, 3) dorsal habitus [Valle de Bravo, México ] 4), antenna, 5) vertex of head, 6) elytral apices, 7) fourth tarsomere, lateral, 8) fourth tarsomere, oblique-ventral (arrows indicate tooth). Figs 9-13,
Microrhopala arizonica Schaeffer
, 9) dorsal habitus [Carr Canyon, Arizona], 10) antenna, 11) vertex of head, 12) elytral apices, 13) fourth tarsomere, oblique-lateral. Habitus images to scale bar; comparable body-part images to scale, respectively.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material of
M. suturalis Weise, 1905:135
. Whereabouts of type material unknown ( Staines 2015 ).

Remarks : The type locality of
M . suturalis Weise
is Canelas, México , here accepted as Canelas in the state of Durango . Weise’s description is reasonably detailed, yet there remains some uncertainty as to which species recognized in the present work it belongs. With the absence of type material for verification, this name remains a subjective junior synonym of
P . suturalis (Baly)
where placed by Weise (1911a) . It is probably correctly placed given the currently-known ranges of both species.
